author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 60-year-old man from Sudan underwent a single lung transplantation procedure at a city hospital recently.

Tarig Osman Humieda, a press release said, was diagnosed with interstitial lung disease, along with end-stage mild pulmonary arterial hypertension. Interstitial lung disease affects the tissue that supports the air sacs in the lungs.

In pulmonary arterial hypertension, a patient has high blood pressure in the arteries that go from the heart to the lungs. A transplant was the only option available to Mr. Humieda at this stage.

Admitted to Frontier Lifeline Hospital, Mr. Humieda was registered under the Tamil Nadu State Cadaver Transplantation programme. On February 2, Mr. Humieda received a lung from a 48-year-old woman who had been declared brain dead at another private hospital, after she had met with an accident.

The organ was transported to Frontier Lifeline within 10 minutes, and reached at 4.09 a.m. N. Madhu Shankar, consultant cardiac surgeon at the hospital, along with his team performed the transplant, in a procedure that lasted four hours. Mr. Humieda had waited in India for almost six months before receiving a transplant. He is now recovering well, and is expected to return to his home country shortly, the release said.

The 60-year-old had interstitial lung disease and arterial hypertension
title: Sudanese man undergoes lung transplant in city
